title: Introducing: Wih’lo
content:
So far this year has been dominated by teenage producers; from xxyyxx to Beat Culture pausing at REID along the way, the ideas being brought to the table by these adolescent musicians are thoroughly exciting and setting the benchmark for their contemporaries.

Instead of idolizing super rich, PR backed ‘DJs’, the youth can look to themselves for inspiration, and more importantly, quality music. Eighteen year old Chicago producer CAN’T Wih’lo  may well find his name being tossed around amongst those previously mentioned, especially off the back of his debut EP Wasted.

Mastering a similar glistening texture to the likes of Beat Culture and xxyyxx, CAN’T centers all four of the tracks around an individual vocal section – “Why can’t we? Bring your body.” (Bring Your) and “I just want the one that makes you happy.” (One That Makes You Happy). It’s the atmospheric density that allow the tracks to gain a semblance of uniqueness, relying upon repetitive loops and sparkling synths to elevate them beyond the level of ‘just another bedroom producer’. Whilst it’s still early days for Wih-lo, this debut EP is one of the most promising releases I’ve heard this year thus far. Stream Wasted below and grab it as a download from his bandcamp.
